body_html:
@nikita68

I think you need to make sure the the encoder_state has a static batch_size which means you need to set your placeholder's batch dimension as batch_size instead of None.

or

you can just use a tensor as the zero_states' batch size instead of a constant.

For example:

decoder_init_state = decoder_cell.zero_state(tf.size(decoder_full_length), tf.float32).clone(cell_state=encoder_state)
body_text:
@nikita68
I think you need to make sure the the encoder_state has a static batch_size which means you need to set your placeholder's batch dimension as batch_size instead of None.
or
you can just use a tensor as the zero_states' batch size instead of a constant.
For example:
decoder_init_state = decoder_cell.zero_state(tf.size(decoder_full_length), tf.float32).clone(cell_state=encoder_state)
body:
@nikita68 

I think you need to make sure the the encoder_state has a static batch_size which means you need to set your placeholder's batch dimension as `batch_size` instead of `None`.

 or 

you can just use a tensor as the zero_states' batch size instead of a constant.

For example:

```
decoder_init_state = decoder_cell.zero_state(tf.size(decoder_full_length), tf.float32).clone(cell_state=encoder_state)
```
